intro: Proboscidea louisianica, commonly known as the Louisiana proboscidea, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Louisiana. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
